title: arbiter5
author: arbiter5
content: Rumours are going around that nChain's CEO left the company because of Craig Wrong's idiotic actions. Good riddance, better late than never.https://twitter.com/WhaleChart/status/1708002711759737205

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: There should be more to his resignation than just this; what's in it for him with the obsession? I believe even an average man doesn't care about what Craig feels like any more or what form of information he has to bring to the table to justify his claim that he is Satoshi; mere fabricated documents can't deceive the entire public; there are more documents required than just documents to prove his claims. Enough of all this drama; if he is truly Satoshi, he would not even think of revealing his identity to anyone for any reason; he could have been more cautious of his privacy than blabbing. What does he tend to gain even if he succeeds in deceiving and convincing a few that he is Satoshi? Does the network look so centralised to him that he will then benefit massively from being the founder?

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Since when he was relevant ever? If there has been discussions about him on this forum is because people either shill for him or make fun of him.

comments.author: FinneysTrueVision
comments.body: Craig only manages to remain in the headlines because he somehow managed to fool Calvin Ayre into funding his scamming. He lost the case filed against him by Dave Kleiman’s family and owes them over $100 million although it’s unlikely he ever owned the BTC they were fighting over and he will just try and drag this out as much as possible.  Craig is a scumbag who will keep harassing Bitcoiners with frivolous lawsuits. Maybe these recent losses has some of his backers thinking they are on a sinking ship and that is why they are abandoning him.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: For now, it's just a Twitter speculation that can easily turn out to be inaccurate. But sure, let's assume for now that it's true.Initially, I couldn't quite understand what's the connection and why the CEO is allegedly quitting, but now I see that Craig Wright is a Chief Scientist at that company. Still, though: why not fire Craig instead of leaving the company? What good does that do if Craig remains employed and a person who doesn't want to be involved with him leaves?Craig is irrelevant, I agree with that. And I'll easily believe that he manipulated evidence in court. But I don't understand why the CEO would quit over it rather than fire the guy.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Wow...finally things are boomerang to this "faketoshi" and soon even his people will be exposing him as such. Right the moment, I got aware of this Mr. Craig Wright, am sure he is definitely Wrong and should never be trusted. He is just using his claim of being the real Satoshi - without credible proofs, of course - to his financial advantages. And I am glad to see some crumbling in his deceitful empire. Craig Wright has no right place within the cryptocurrency industry.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: It is confirmed. Christen Ager-Hanssen announces his departure as nChain CEO and expressed his conviction that Craig Wright is NOT Satoshi and predicts that he will lose all his legal battles. https://twitter.com/agerhanssen/status/1707884086776279486I wonder what made him change his mind?

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: he was only CEO of 10 months (nov 2022-sept 2023)im surprised it took him that long to realise the scams of CSW. i thought a business guy with his work history would have done more due diligence before taking the job last year.. though i feel his role was not a proper CEO. but more of just a place holder name on a shell company just to make nchain seem legit as a proper business.. but not actually doing anything practically.. so basically it was just a income for a name badge.. and (my speculation) is 1 year contract was coming up for renewal and he simply did not want to extend it

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Oh. Why does it take too long to understand that CSW is scumbag? What makes them think that CSW could be a real Satoshi? I always thought that all his employees knew he was a scumbag, but they still work for money. But the case seems different for the CEO of nChain. The hashtag he used is #Faketoshi, which also makes me laugh and happy. Quote from: digaran on September 30, 2023, 07:31:56 AMSince when he was relevant ever? If there has been discussions about him on this forum is because people either shill for him or make fun of him. I don't think Bitcointalk people ever cared about CSW. We all know he is a scammer! I don't remember correctly, but maybe Suchmoon had a thread about his scams. I could be wrong.

comments.author: kingvirtus09
comments.body: As long as I see that person, the reason he does such a thing is just because of fame or popularity. How many years has he been pretending to be the founder of Bitcoin? which is obviously not really, he is still bragging, that if we look at the history record that the real Satoshi is silent and anonymous, and no one knows until now, you are a silent bitcoin whale holder.People like that should be ignored, just to be honest. He uses cryptocurrency for his personal interests, that's all.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: The same story repeats over and over again. You make some nice headlines and maybe get media attention with some negative news and boom there is your company and it’s shares making some moves. For this guy, he has mastered all the arts of making money by defaulting the others impressions on their decisions. What I mean is simple, he is literally an attention seeker and nothing else. The CEO who left might have been into other heated positions and could have left on the command of Craig. You never know if this news is even true or not since one can also try to gain positive attention to form new entity and have personal gains. This is really sucked up for Craig since it can be held as an evidence against Craig in the court. Either way we don’t care because this is just non ending drama anyways.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on September 30, 2023, 07:31:56 AMSince when he was relevant ever? If there has been discussions about him on this forum is because people either shill for him or make fun of him.To be fair, whether we like it or not, he was pretty relevant in the days of the fork wars. Not because he could overtake BTC, but the fact that having bitcoin forks(BCH and BSV) in the top 10-20 on CoinMarketCap/CoinGecko can easily confuse newbies.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: I think this is just another drama for him that he is Satoshi and I'd rather agree with him being Faketoshi. For Christen Ager-Hanssen, I would say that he made the right choice to leave as he may face a problem when the drama started especially when he said he reported that he found evidence about craig manipulating the documents. Well, it's better to be safe than sorry if you ask me and I wouldn done the same.
